content:
Founders and Coders is supported by a diverse community of mentors, volunteers, and industry partners who provide guidance, support, and career opportunities to its graduates. Here are some of the key groups of people involved in Founders and Coders:

1. Mentors - Founders and Coders has a network of experienced mentors who work closely with the students. These mentors are experienced web developers who volunteer their time to provide guidance and support to the students.
2. Volunteers - Founders and Coders also relies on volunteers who help with various aspects of the program, such as organizing events, providing administrative support, and helping with marketing and outreach.
3. Industry Partners - Founders and Coders has established partnerships with a number of leading tech companies and startups. These partners provide career opportunities to graduates and also help to shape the curriculum to ensure that it is relevant to the needs of the tech industry.
4. Alumni - Founders and Coders also has a strong alumni community, with graduates who continue to be involved in the organization as mentors, volunteers, and supporters. The alumni community also provides a valuable network of contacts and resources for current students and recent graduates.
